newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: ABB wins Greek power plant order.
newsitem.headline: ABB wins Greek power plant order.

text.p: Electrical engineering group ABB Asea Brown Boveri AG said a consortium it led had won a turnkey contract to build a 330-megawatt lignite-fired power plant in northern Greece.
ABB's share is $200 million out of a total contract value of $665 million, the company said in a statement.
ABB said the contract was awarded by Greek state utility Public Power Corporation (PPC).
It named the other consortium members as EVT of Stuttgart, Germany, Moscow-based Technopromexport (TPE) and Prometheus Gas S.A. of Athens.
The plant at Meliti near Florina would supply power for the area of Macedonia, ABB said. The plant would burn local lignite coal and was scheduled to start operation in late 1999.

ABB said it would supply electrical and control systems, the flue-gas desulphurization system, the water and steam supply systems, the balance of plant as well as low-voltage equipment and the complete electrical installation work.
It said the plant would conform to the latest European environmental protection standards to produce low emissions while achieving high overall efficieny.
